greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular pairs (p,2k) ordered by increasing k.
comment: The subsequence of irregular primes p is A046753.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..132
B. C. Kellner, On irregular prime power divisors of the Bernoulli numbers, arXiv:math/0409223 [math.NT], 2004-2005; Math. Comp. 76 (2007), 405-441.
B. Mazur, How can we construct abelian Galois extensions of basic number fields?, Bull. Amer. Math. Soc., 48 (2011), 155-209. See footnote 64 on p. 205.
mathematica: Flatten[Table[p = Select[First /@ FactorInteger[Abs[Numerator[BernoulliB[n]]]], # >= n+3 &]; Transpose[{p, Table[n, {Length[p]}]}], {n, 2, 70, 2}]] (* _T. D. Noe_, Apr 25 2011 *)
results.author: _Jonathan Sondow_, Apr 25 2011
